defs: a food baked from a leavened, kneaded dough made with flour or meal, water, etc.; bread.
a small flat cake of sweetened dough fried in ghee or oil; a kind of dough-nut.
a contagious skin disease caused by a parasitic mite (Sarcoptes scabiei) that burrows under the skin to deposit eggs, causing intense itching; scabies.
composed or made of several yarns or threads, hence, thick or stout.
a length of material made of several fibres, yarns, etc. twisted together.
the sun.
any of a family (Lampyridae) of winged beetles, active at night, whose abdomens usu. glow with a luminescent light; a firefly.
any of various plants of the grass family that are usu. used for food, fodder or grazing and as lawns; grass.
a deep, dark well, usu. without water.
the thick, stringy mucus secreted by the mucous glands of the respiratory tract and discharged from the throat, as during a cold; phlegm.
a small axe with a short handle, for use with one hand; a hatchet.
an agricultural implement with a cutting blade fixed in a frame drawn usu. by draught animals, used to prepare the soil for sowing or planting, by cutting furrows in it and turning it up; a plough.
the closed fist.

a jarlike container to spit into; a cuspidor; a spittoon.
an act or spell of struggling; a continued effort to resist force or free oneself from constraint; a strong effort under difficulties; struggle.
a difficult, unpleasant or embarassing situation.
the act of causing anger or distress to another.
the quality or an instance of talking without a break.
a debt that cannot be recovered; a bad-debt.
a person who does not repay the loan taken from another.
bad; not good; of defective quality or worth; worthless; inferior; deficient; deteriorated.
a strong two-wheeled conveyance usu. with a low-sided rectangular body, drawn by a bullock or a pair of bullocks, used esp. in farming and for carrying people, goods, etc.; a bullock-cart.
an ostentatious display; an empty show to draw attention; vanity; ostentation.
a try, esp. a hard try; an attempt; an endeavor; an effort.
a continuous, confused, noise as of many excited voices; buzz.

physically powerful; robust; strong; not easily affected by outside force or influence.
unreasonably determined to have one's own way; not yielding to reason or plea; strongly inclined towards; stubborn; obstinate.
absolute, perfect or complete truth; fact.
a man whose work is killing animals, and cutting up meat for sale; a butcher.
a man who catches, traps, hunts or shoots whild birds for sale; a fowler.
a rubbing or drawing of a line by rubbing for testing the purity of gold and silver pieces using a touchstone and the goldsmith's needle.
(fig.) any test of genuineness or value; ಖಟ್ಟಿಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚು k haṭṭige haccu to subject to a severe test or tests to ascertain the genuineness, correct value or worth.
a prescribed rule; an authoritative direction; the act of prscribing a rule; a rgulating or regulation; a code.

a specified or prescribed length of time.
an established social convention carried on by tradition; a custom.
an action to secure justice in a court of law; a law-suit.
a way, path or course of movement; the course to be followed.
a framework for supporting the bedspring and mattress of a bed; a bedstead.

a device, as a seat hanging from ropes or chains, on which one can sit and swing backward and forward as a form of amusement; a length of netting, canvas, etc. swung from ropes at both ends and used as a bed or couch; a swing; a hammock.

a club or staff with a skull at the top considered as the weapon of Śiva and carried by ascetics and yogis.
